page.title: 19HALLOWEEN
page.content: {"Its your turn McIlhatton, when you {have knocked the door, hide behind {that old wooden stub."}I knocked the door, scampered up the steps to my hiding place. Out came the owner of the house. When he found nobody there he soon realised some body was playing the{joker.}He walked up the steps at a slow pace crouching his head over the hedge and staring. His {eyes burned with anger}and lit up the {expression on his face.}Mean-while I was hidden and sitting as still as stillness wondering what would happen. The old man got over the hedge and began to nose around. He was getting closer,{I could feel the shadow of {him behind me,}I wasn't waiting any longer, up I got, over the hedge, home was my destination.{"Get out of here {before I fell you"}I didn't wait to be told a second time.
